places.name: Batumi Boulevard
places.description: A stunning 7-kilometer seaside park stretching along the Black Sea coast, dotted with palm trees, art installations, monuments, dancing fountains, and entertainment venues.
places.why_visit: One of the most important attractions in Batumi, offering a perfect blend of nature, art, and seaside recreation with spectacular Black Sea views.

places.name: Ali and Nino Statue
places.description: An 8-meter-high moving kinetic sculpture by Tamara Kvesitadze depicting two lovers who move toward each other, merge briefly, and separate every 10 minutes.
places.why_visit: A mesmerizing symbol of love and tolerance that becomes even more spectacular at night when illuminated, representing the tragic romance between a Muslim boy and Georgian princess.

places.name: Argo Cable Car
places.description: Batumi's premier attraction spanning 2,586 meters, ascending 256 meters to Anuria Mountain with panoramic views of the city and Black Sea, leading to a cultural entertainment complex.
places.why_visit: Offers the most spectacular aerial views of Batumi and the Black Sea during a 15-minute journey, with authentic Georgian dining and entertainment at the summit.

places.name: Batumi Botanical Garden
places.description: Founded in 1912, this second-largest botanical garden in the world spans over 100 hectares on a hillside overlooking the Black Sea, featuring thousands of plant species from nine phyto-geographical zones.
places.why_visit: A botanical paradise showcasing flora from around the world including East Asia, the Himalayas, and Mediterranean regions, with breathtaking coastal views.

places.name: Alphabet Tower
places.description: A unique 130-meter tower featuring 33 Georgian alphabet letters in a DNA-inspired double helix design, topped with a rotating panoramic restaurant.
places.why_visit: Combines architectural innovation celebrating Georgian heritage with spectacular 360-degree views of Batumi and fine dining at the revolving Atmosphere Restaurant.

places.name: Gonio Fortress
places.description: An ancient Roman fortification dating back to the 1st century AD, located 12 km south of Batumi near the Turkish border, featuring well-preserved walls and rich historical significance.
places.why_visit: Step back two millennia into Roman history at one of Georgia's most important archaeological sites with remarkably preserved fortification walls.

places.name: Batumi Piazza
places.description: A charming 5,700-square-meter Italian-style plaza featuring Venetian architecture, stained glass windows, cafes, restaurants, and Europe's largest figurative marble mosaic (106 sq m) at its center.
places.why_visit: Experience romantic Italian ambiance in the heart of Batumi with live music evenings, charming cafes, and stunning architectural details.

places.name: Europe Square
places.description: The historic heart of Batumi's Old Town featuring the iconic Medea Monument at its center, surrounded by beautiful architecture and serving as a cultural gathering point.
places.why_visit: A must-visit historic square blending architectural beauty with cultural significance, showcasing singing fountains in the evening and hosting performances by world celebrities.

places.name: Batumi Dolphinarium
places.description: A popular family attraction offering entertaining and educational dolphin shows in 6 May Park, with opportunities to watch performances and even swim with dolphins.
places.why_visit: Ranked #2 attraction in Batumi on TripAdvisor, offering unforgettable 45-minute dolphin shows that delight visitors of all ages.

places.name: Holy Mother Virgin Nativity Cathedral
places.description: A magnificent neo-Gothic Orthodox cathedral featuring three domes, stunning stained glass windows, and intricate 19th-century architecture.
places.why_visit: One of Batumi's most beautiful religious buildings, combining neo-Gothic architectural elegance with Orthodox spiritual significance and artistic craftsmanship.
